00048 /*===========================================================================
00049  *
00050  *      File :          l_alloc_new.h
00051  *      Description :   New and improved data structure allocation/mgmt
00052  *      Creation Date : May 1993
00053  *      Authors :       John C. Gyllenhaal and Wen-mei Hwu
00054  *      Contributors:   Roger Bringmann and Scott Mahlke
00055  *
00056  *==========================================================================*/
00057 #ifndef L_ALLOC_NEW_H
00058 #define L_ALLOC_NEW_H
00059 
00060 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00061 #include <config.h>
00062 #include <stdio.h>
00063 
00064 typedef struct _L_Alloc_Pool_Header
00065 {
00066   struct _L_Alloc_Pool_Header *next;
00067 }
00068 L_Alloc_Pool_Header;
00069 
00070 typedef struct _L_Alloc_Pool
00071 {
00072   char *name;
00073   int element_size;
00074   int block_size;               /* Block size to allocate */
00075   int num_in_block;             /* Num elements in block */
00076   struct _L_Alloc_Pool_Header *head;     /* Pointer to head of free list */
00077   int allocated;                /* Number allocated */
00078   int free;                     /* Number free */
00079   int blocks_allocated;
00080   struct _L_Alloc_Pool_Header *block_list; /* Pointer to blocks allocated */
00081   int bypass_routines;
00082   struct _L_Alloc_Pool *next;
00083 }
00084 L_Alloc_Pool;
00085 
00086 #define L_ALLOC_POOL(typ) L_Alloc_Pool *L_alloc_pool_##typ = NULL
00087 #define L_INIT_ALLOC_POOL(typ,sz) { if (!L_alloc_pool_##typ)                  \
00088                     L_alloc_pool_##typ =  L_create_alloc_pool ("typ",         \
00089                     sizeof(typ), sz); }
00090 #define L_DEINIT_ALLOC_POOL(typ) { if (L_alloc_pool_##typ) {                  \
00091                     L_free_alloc_pool (L_alloc_pool_##typ)                    \
00092                     L_alloc_pool_##typ = NULL; }}
00093 #define L_ALLOC(typ)      (typ *)L_alloc(L_alloc_pool_##typ)
00094 #define L_FREE(typ, p)    {L_free(L_alloc_pool_##typ, p),p = NULL;}
00095 
00096 /* Prototypes */
00097 #ifdef __cplusplus
00098 extern "C"
00099 {
00100 #endif
00101 
00102   extern L_Alloc_Pool *L_create_alloc_pool (char *, int, int);
00103   /* (char *name, int size, int num_in_block) */
00104   extern void L_free_alloc_pool (L_Alloc_Pool *);
00105   /* (L_Alloc_Pool *pool) */
00106 
00107   extern void *L_alloc (L_Alloc_Pool *);
00108   /* (L_Alloc_Pool *pool) */
00109   extern void L_free (L_Alloc_Pool *, void *);
00110   /* (L_Alloc_Pool *pool, void *ptr) */
00111   extern long L_print_alloc_info (FILE *, L_Alloc_Pool *, int);
00112   /* (FILE *F, L_Alloc_Pool *pool, int verbose) */
00113 
00114   extern void L_summarize_allocation_info (FILE *fp);
00115 
00116 #ifdef __cplusplus
00117 }
00118 #endif
00119 
00120 
00121 /* 
00122  * Set this to 1 before creating an alloc pool to bypass alloc routines
00123  * so that malloc and free are called each time L_alloc and L_free are called
00124  * with that alloc pool. 
00125  * This allows efficient use of the debug malloc routines.
00126  */
00127 
00128 #ifdef __cplusplus
00129 extern "C"
00130 {
00131 #endif
00132 
00133   extern int bypass_alloc_routines;
00134 
00135 #ifdef __cplusplus
00136 }
00137 #endif
00138 
00139 #endif
